content.description: Easy climbing with big holds for 50 feet. The next 25 feet is the crux which climbs vertical, less featured rock, requiring more thought and balance. Clip the last bolt from a hidden jug then scramble to the chains.
content.location: Hike uphill along the base of Blue Wall. At the top turn a right-corner and find the route on a west facing section of Blue Wall. Plan on about a 45 minute hike from the parking lot.

content.description:
Tom Caldwell smacked his head on the rock when he was doing the redpoint for the first ascent, thus the name 'Hardheaded...'. Also a reference to a Soundgarden song. Easier version of

Stealin

. Crux is near the 5th bolt.
content.location:
Slog up the scree slope and head west when you get to the cliff wall. About 8 feet to the left of

Got Caught Stealing

.

content.description: When this area was being developed (if you can call 2 routes developed) someone stole the rope that was left on this route between drill sessions. First bolt is about 15 feet off the ground. Crux is the move from the 4th to the 5th bolt. Crux hold has been glued. Climbing is a little technical.
content.location:
Once you get to the wall at the top of the scree slope, continue west until you get past the steep corner.

Got Caught Stealing

is about 20 feet west of the steep corner and the first fully bolted route you'll come to.

content.description:
Not a destination route, but a good route when done as a second pitch to

Wizard of Wiz

. Plentiful holds and big edges make this a cruiser pitch. Do this pitch in your approach shoes.
content.location:
From the top of

Wizard of Wiz

, walk a short distance uphill to the next large buttress. Look uphill to the left for the bolt line.
